entries.next: If I find any more work I think you can handle, I'll let you know.
entries.player_sorry_4: Not yet.  I will shortly, though!
entries.player_reset_4: You lazy sack of bones!  It just dawned on me that I'm doing all your work!  I'm through with you.
entries.player_3_4: Do you ever actually hunt anything yourself?
entries.player_2_4: I've been doing this the whole time and haven't learned a thing from you!  I'm done with this!
entries.player_1_4: Only as long as it's a challenge.  If I don't barely make it out there alive, it's not worth it!
entries.npc_work_4: So have you shown that dewback who the master is?
entries.npc_reward_4: You've done far better than I ever thought you would. It's a pity the League isn't accepting new applicants just now.
entries.npc_reset_4: Not everybody has what it takes to make it in this business. Some just choke under the pressure.
entries.npc_backtowork_4: Really?  Wow.  Um... I mean... yeah, I'll expect this done.
entries.npc_4_4: You're a cheeky one, you are! I was hunting krayts when you were still learning not to drool on yourself. Bah!
entries.npc_3_4: Not everybody has what it takes to make it in this business. Some just choke under the pressure.
entries.npc_2_4: Think you've got what it takes? All right then, track down a grizzled dewback and bring back the hide. Try not to scorch it. A museum wants to stuff it for a display of dangerous wildlife.
entries.npc_1_4: You've done a bang-up job so far, but now you'll have to grow up a little. I'm not sure you're up to this job, but I thought you might enjoy a challenge. Interested?
entries.player_sorry_3: No, I was waiting for her to leave the pack.  I didn't want to spook the rest.
entries.player_sorry_2: No, I've only found normal womprats.  I'm still looking for one of those variegated types.
entries.player_reset_3: I can't do it, Mat!  I'm scared to death of banthas!  And a bantha this big?  Nightmares, I tell you.
entries.player_reset_2: Look, if I can't even pronounce the name of the thing I'm supposed to kill, I shouldn't be hunting it.  I'm out.
entries.npc_reset_3: Probably a wise decision. I expect that last creature was about the limit of your skills.
entries.npc_reset_2: I thought you were a little too dim to do this.  When you've learned how to read, look me up, okay?
entries.npc_backtowork_3: Hmmm... you know, that's a pretty good idea.  I'll have to remember that.  I mean - yeah - I'm glad to see you're learning.
entries.npc_backtowork_2: Yeah, they can be little buggers.  Keep looking!
entries.npc_work_3: So, have you killed that big monster?
entries.npc_work_2: Have you skinned that little sucker yet?
entries.npc_work_1: So, are those little beasties feasting on the that squill yet?
entries.cantwork: You have another employer at the moment. But if you're serious about hunting, see me when you have some free time.
entries.npc_reset_1: You've got to be kidding me.  Well, before you trying hunting squill, you may need to track down a spine.  I'm sure that will help.
entries.npc_backtowork_1: Whatever.  I'll be surprised if you can get this done at all.
entries.player_sorry_1: No, that squill has so far managed to elude my tracking skills.  I'll get one for the Jawas, don't worry.
entries.player_reset_1: I saw that squill, and it's HUGE!!!  You're crazy to send me out against something like that!
entries.player_3_3: What is the prey this time?
entries.player_3_2: What are we after this time?
entries.player_2_3: Okay, you just said 'krayt'.  I'm outta here.
entries.player_2_2: If this is anywhere as dangerous as the last one, count me out!
entries.player_1_3: Ha!  I'll kill it blindfolded!!!  With one hand tied behind my back, too!  No, both hands!!!!!
entries.player_1_2: I'll kill whatever you want me to!
entries.npc_reward_2: Bagged the beastie, did you? Smashing good job there, old desert rat. Why, one day your name may be known with the same reverence as mine!
entries.npc_reward_1: I say! You do seem to have passable basic skills. I might consider taking you on as a pupil. I'll let those Jawas know their meat is ready for them.
entries.npc_4_3: I've been asked to get another trophy item -- a matriarch bantha. It's the sort of trivial job I like to pass down to younger hunters who really need the work.
entries.npc_4_2: Apparently he wants the hide of a variegated womp rat. Why anybody would want one of those filthy biters is beyond me, but there you are. Your decision?
entries.npc_4_1: Some Jawas recently approached me about killing a desert squill. Far beneath my abilities, of course, but a good test of your basic skills.
entries.npc_3_3: Probably a wise decision. I expect that last creature was about the limit of your skills.
entries.npc_3_2: Are you sure you're serious about this line of work? You don't seem to have the dedication of a hunter.
entries.npc_3_1: Don't feel up to it? I guess you don't have what it takes to be a real hunter.
entries.npc_2_3: You certainly have gumption. I admire that, really. Track down a matriarch bantha and bring back the horns for our client. Foul beast, the bantha. Honestly, I wonder about people's taste in décor.
entries.npc_2_2: Good show! Bring back the hide from a variegated womp rat, and we'll make a professional hunter of you yet.
entries.npc_2_1: That's the spirit. Head into the desert and find a squill for the Jawas. They wanted the meat, as I recall, so be sure to bring back the carcass.
entries.npc_1_3: I was offered another commission recently, one well beneath the abilities of myself, to whom even the biggest krayt is a simple afternoon's diversion. You might find it a tad interesting, though.
entries.npc_1_2: I have another job for you. An offworlder wants to take a hunting trophy back home with him. It's the sort of thing that I wouldn't trouble myself with, but as your mentor, I encourage you to do all the fieldwork you can. What do you say?
entries.npc_1_1: If you're interested in becoming a hunter, I might have a little job for you -- just to show your aptitude, you understand. Up for it?
